#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <stdbool.h>

int main() {
    char s[1024];
    fgets(s, sizeof(s), stdin);
    s[strcspn(s, "\n")] = '\0'; // remove newline if present

    char res[2048];
    int res_index = 0;

    // Define punctuation
    const char *punctuation = ",.!?";
    int len = strlen(s);

    for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
        if (i == 0) {
            // Handle first character
            if (s[i] == ' ' || strchr(punctuation, s[i]) != NULL) {
                continue;
            } else {
                res[res_index++] = s[i];
            }
        } else {
            if (s[i] == ' ') {
                // Check previous in res is not space
                if (res_index > 0 && res[res_index - 1] != ' ') {
                    res[res_index++] = ' ';
                }
            } else if (strchr(punctuation, s[i]) != NULL) {
                // Check previous is space
                if (res_index > 0 && res[res_index - 1] == ' ') {
                    res_index--; // remove the space
                }
                res[res_index++] = s[i];
                // Add space after punctuation
                res[res_index++] = ' ';
            } else {
                res[res_index++] = s[i];
            }
        }
    }

    // After processing, handle trailing space from punctuation
    // If the last character is a space added after punctuation, maybe we need to check?
    // For example, if the input ends with punctuation, the code adds a space. But maybe the original code would end with a space.

    // Also, the original code may have a trailing space. Let's see.

    // The original code appends a space after punctuation. So the result could end with a space.

    // But let's proceed as per the code.

    res[res_index] = '\0';

    printf("%s\n", res);

    return 0;
}
